description.narrative: Interventionen handlar om att bygga upp kapaciteten hos KNBS och det nationella statistiska systemet (NSS) i Kenya i syfte att dessa ska kunna spela sin roll i nationell utveckling och fattigdomsminskning. Insatsen föreslås genomföras i form av institutionelt samarbete ("twinning") med svenska Statistiska Centralbyrån (SCB). Begreppet kapacitet används ofta som ett samlingsbegrepp för de villkor som måste vara på plats för att möjliggöra utveckling, t ex kunskap, kompetens, effektiva och utvecklingsinriktade organisationer samt institutionella ramverk. Institutionellt twinning-samarbete är en form av stöd till kapacitetsutveckling där samarbetet främjar professionella band mellan institutionerna och mellan enskilda tjänstemän och experter.

The overall objective of the intervention is to enhance the Institutional, Organizational and Technical capacity of the KNBS and the National Statistical system (NSS) in Kenya through an institutional twining arrangement with statistics Sweden (SCB). The intervention is relevant to Kenya's development priorities as captured in Vision 2030 and the Second Medium term Plan (MTP). It is in line with the Swedens strategy for development cooperation with Kenya for the period 2009-2013.

The original overall objective of the intervention was to enhance the institutional, organizational and technical capacity of the KNBS and the National Statistical System (NSS) in Kenya to produce relevant, reliable and timely statistical information in line with international standards. KNBS and SCB feel that the development objective was not stated clearly in the original project document (2014-10-07)[1] and therefore state that the long-term objective of the cooperation that “policy makers in the Kenyan society shall base their decisions on unbiased, reliable and qualitative information that helps them to design policies that contributes to a better environment, limited climate impact and strengthened resilience, a democratic development of society and improved opportunities for poor people to support themselves.” The project objective of the extension phase of the project is that “KNBS’ capacity to produce and disseminate statistics shall be improved”. The project components and their objectives are as follows: *Management capacity: KNBS shall improve production planning and declaration of statistical quality. *Economic statistics: the quality of economic statistics shall be improved in accordance with international standards. *Agriculture statistics: improve the range of agricultural statistics, i.e., the number of agriculture indicators *Gender statistics: improve the range of gender statistics, i.e., the number of gender indicators should increase. *Information and communication technology (ICT): ICT infrastructure in place that facilitates efficient production and dissemination of statistics. [1] “Swedish support to statistics development at Kenya National Bureau of Statistics (KNBS): A cooperation project between KNBS and Statistics Sweden (SCB): Financed by: The Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (Sida): September 2014 – September 2018” (Statistics Sweden and KNBS, 2014-10-07).

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: “KNBS has an updated and improved Business Register that can be used as a comprehensive and up to date sampling frame. This is a major accomplishment for the project. “Together with Statistics Norway, a new IT system has been introduced for the Business Register. “The support on the popular version of the Economic Survey together with the manual on visual identity for KNBS has strengthened a more user-friendly dissemination standard. “24 persons have gone through the Young Statistician Programme. The programme has alleviated some of the most pressing staffing issues in the statistical production. “75 staff members from both county offices and the central office have participated in courses and trainings in basic and advanced statistics. This has increased the knowledge and understandings for the statistical production process at KNBS. “Rebasing for both Consumer Price Index (CPI) and Producer Price Index (PPI) is well on the way and will be finalised during the next phase of the project in 2020. The first steps towards an implementation of a new electronic data collection system for CPI, CPI Mobile, has been taken and will continue to play an important part of the support in 2020. “The rebasing of the Kenyan National Accounts is going on well with a strong support from the project. Capacity has been developed to a degree that the next rebasing will be handled by KNBS without the need of external technical support.” From Kenya National Bureau of Statistics and Statistics Sweden, “Statistical Cooperation Project Between the Kenya National Bureau of Statistics (KNBS) and Statistics Sweden: Final report, phase 1: February 2015 – July 2019 [May 4, 2020], pp. 4-5
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
